```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
m <- sample(10:99, 1) # mass (kg)
h <- sample(1:10, 1) # height (m)

ans <- m * 9.8 * h
dis <- c(m*h)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\mathsf{\\,J}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```

Question
========
An object of mass `r fmt(m, 1)` kg is `r fmt(h, 2)` m above the ground.
What is its gravitational potential energy relative to the ground?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```


Solution
========
The gravitational potential energy is
$$E_p = mgh = (`r m` \mathsf{\,kg})(9.80 \mathsf{\,m/s^2})(`r h` \mathsf{\,m}) = `r signif(ans, 3)` \mathsf{\,J}$$
